intro: Pimpinella armena, commonly known as Armenian cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Central Asia, it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its biennial or perennial growth habit varies depending on the climate and environmental conditions.
